I thoroughly enjoyed my stay at the lovely Stella house. It’s a sweet little bungalow, that also somehow has the feeling of a cabin, a cottage, and a Victorian home all rolled into one. I would definitely stay here again.
There is a display sharing some historical information about the home and it’s previous owners. That, along with the many antique furnishings, makes it feel like you’re in a history-house as well.
Other than the TV, the amenities are not shiny and modern. The bedding, towels, and kitchen essentials met my needs more than sufficiently. The house shows the wear and patina (and the quirks) of a 100+ year old home. I found this charming and beautiful. If polished, spotless, and contemporary furnishings (and pampering amenities) are what you feel you require, then choosing a different place to stay might be a better option for you.
I recommend staying at the Stella house to visit Balaton, and to explore the small towns, countryside, and history of Southwest Minnesota.

Sunny and Merryweather Farm are both completely wonderful. We didn’t want to leave. We stayed in the Settler’s Cabin, a dry cabin, on the unseasonably cold and wet first weekend in May. There is a heater to each room; hot, cold, and rain water available a few steps away from the cabin, and a nice private bathroom for guest use at the back of the house closest to the cabin. We brought much of our own food to cook in the instant pot- but she had a nice electric skillet, coffee maker, microwave- and a nice larger mini-fridge with drawers and a freezer. There was plexiglass put over the screened in porch windows to ensure the warmth stayed in during the colder seasons. The beds were incredibly comfortable and well-appointed with high quality cotton quilts and linens. Pillows and mattresses were well thought out. She also left us tasty baked goods and some cooking essentials such as: farm eggs, garlic, potatoes, peppers and onions. Sunny has maximized the space and comforts of the cabin; balancing the necessities with the cozy-rustic character. It felt good to not have running water, to walk to a bathroom, to be a little chilly at times, to sleep under a mountain of blankets- and to be mindful about what one really needs to survive and be comfortable.
The farm itself is lovely, and I plan to return when things green up in the coming seasons. I am already missing Ernie the “much-to-say” cat! Max, Jack, and Sissy the pups will make you smile. Sunny has put much heart and hard work into the farm and accommodations.
The farm and cabin are a perfect respite from our constantly in-motion world. Do yourself a favor and have a stay.
